abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact was substantial. Lessons of experience
            are expressed as follows. Particularly during crisis
            situations, project design should take into account the
            speed with which assistance can be delivered, i.e., complex
            structures and processes that slow activities, and
            disbursements should be avoided, and agencies should have a
            clear understanding of the requirements involved with Bank
            operations. It is reinforced that during project
            preparation, an up-front assessment of implementing agency
            capacity is needed. Such an assessment, although
            time-consuming, would help inform project design, and the
            development of a realistic timeline, as well as identify
            necessary technical assistance to ensure a smooth project
            implementation. Under a crisis situation, or emergency
            operation, in particular, the Bank must provide substantial
            on-the-job training and assistance at the beginning of the
            operation, which would likely require higher than the norm
            budget allocations. Likewise, the structure of a
            crisis-response project should allow sufficient flexibility
            to accommodate changing circumstances, and provide
            incentives to help mitigate risk. A focus on outcomes, both
            in design and supervision, is critical in determining
            whether a project is delivering the intended results, and
            whether adjustments are required. To this end, indicators
            should move beyond tracking outputs (i.e. number of
            trainees, number of roads constructed) to analyzing the
            quality and impact of such achievements (i.e. employment
            gained as a result of training, sustainability and benefits
            of infrastructure created). The challenge of developing
            measurable indicators for community empowerment, social
            capital, and capacity building objectives must also be addressed.
